channel.title: The struggle of programming
channel.description: :palm: How come when you start to program like when i was months ago you have so much trouble? Seriously like it took me so long to get used to java and I'm still learning new things. Life in programming get better and better as you go! [IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/qz0oq8.jpg[/img]

item.title: The struggle of programming
item.dc:creator: @Techkid Techkid
item.description:
@Techkid wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:5, topic:532951”]With a language like Java you should be able to go from zero to competent beginner in maybe 10 weeks. And I’m not talking 10 weeks of 8 hour work days. Maybe three hours per week of reading (or attending a university lecture) and two or three hours per week of programming assignments (which should probably include use of classes and objects, shallow inheritance and composition, array manipulation, introductory sorting and searching algorithms, and elementary data structures such as the linked list and queue).

If your pathway is 20 minutes of reading some online tutorial followed by ‘fudge this shit, I’ll just learn from Moparscape server tutorials’ then you’ll never be any good at it, nor will you have an understanding of anything beyond the trivial.[/quote]
Sir you didnt think before you posted this… I have gone through lectures documentations and tutorials! I know what im learning! Watching a vid is just like a lecture but easy for visual learners. Just wanted to clear this up

Read full topic

item.title: The struggle of programming
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

With a language like Java you should be able to go from zero to competent beginner in maybe 10 weeks. And I’m not talking 10 weeks of 8 hour work days. Maybe three hours per week of reading (or attending a university lecture) and two or three hours per week of programming assignments (which should probably include use of classes and objects, shallow inheritance and composition, array manipulation, introductory sorting and searching algorithms, and elementary data structures such as the linked list and queue).

If your pathway is 20 minutes of reading some online tutorial followed by ‘fuck this shit, I’ll just learn from Moparscape server tutorials’ then you’ll never be any good at it, nor will you have an understanding of anything beyond the trivial.

Read full topic
